resource.chars:
It presents an edge anteriorly  and superiorly  - and on 
each side of this - the lateral surfaces are beset with 
a series of small, oval, ciliated spaces - In this 
species the gill has but a single grand sinus  running 
through it - and presents no appearance of vascular 
ramifications - The name gill has been applied to 
this structure somewhat too exclusively as there can be little 
doubt that the whole respiratory cavity performs the branchial 
function [text?] proposed to call it the <u>hypopharyngeal <\u> band 
on the supposition that the proper respiratory cavity of the Ascidians answers to an enlarged 
pharynx
